title: Part A
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that evolutionary fitness is usually measured by reproductive success or that it is measured by the number of offspring produced.
The response indicates that evolutionary fitness is usually measured by reproductive success or that it is measured by the number of offspring produced.

title: Part B (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The sketched bars meet none of the criteria below.
The sketched bars meet one of the criteria below.
The sketched bars meet two of the criteria below.
The sketched bars meet all of the criteria below.

title: Part B (ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that based on the lack of overlap among error bars for each allele, there IS a significant difference in the frequency of EACH allele among the three populations.
The response indicates that based on the lack of overlap among error bars for each allele, there IS a significant difference in the frequency of EACH allele among the three populations.

title: Part C (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that population 3 is likely to have the highest frequency of heterozygotes (because in population 3 all alleles are present at closest to the same frequencies).
The response indicates that population 3 is likely to have the highest frequency of heterozygotes (because in population 3 all alleles are present at closest to the same frequencies).

title: Part C (ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that the frequency of animals in population 1 that carry both alleles 1 and 3 is 0.3 or 30%. title: Part D (i)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that the number of animals in population 2 will decline. Many of the animals in population 2 are likely to have trouble finding and identifying sources of food.
The response indicates that the number of animals in population 2 will decline. Many of the animals in population 2 are likely to have trouble finding and identifying sources of food.

title: Part D (ii)
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions: The response does not indicate that population 2 has the least genetic diversity of alleles of the opsin gene. The primates in this population will primarily see one wavelength of light/color, that dictated by allele 1, and so may have difficulty distinguishing other new and different forms of food.

The response indicates that population 2 has the least genetic diversity of alleles of the opsin gene. The primates in this population will primarily see one wavelength of light/color, that dictated by allele 1, and so may have difficulty distinguishing other new and different forms of food.
